positions.title: MongoDB
positions.description:
* Develop MongoDB's Professional Services business, Customer Success program, and Pre-Sales (Solutions Architects) function
* Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Legal, Finance teams to grow MongoDB globally.
* Collaborate with Product Management, Engineering to inform product direction based on field experience.

positions.title: Software Engineer
positions.description:
* Maintenance programming on MongoDB core server.
* Developed and maintain infrastructure for packaging MongoDB for various Linux distributions.
* Enhanced CI infrastructure, regression testing frameworks.
* Consulted/advised customers with MongoDB deployments.

positions.title: SBCL Hacker (contract work)
positions.description:
Brought into ITA to work on Steel Bank Common Lisp compiler and runtime for use in ITA's airfare search engine. While there, I made some changes to SBCL's compiler that improved its performance by about 10% on ITA's code base. After a few months, I also worked on ITA's search engine product: routine bug fixes, small feature additions, standard sort of maintenance work on a large, mature software system.
…
see more

positions.title: Bioinformatics Analyst
positions.companyName: Cornell University (Dept. of Plant Breeding & Genetics)
positions.description: Developed and maintained existing bioinformatics software, including web-based and batch-oriented database-backed Perl programs for manipulating and presenting genomic data for plants related to the tomato.

positions.title: System Administrator (part time)
positions.description: Administered a co-located host for a few dozen customers with web-based applications, mostly written in PHP. Performed some PHP work for a few customers.

positions.title: System Administrator
positions.description: Administered a network of Unix and Linux server hosts, MacOS and Windows workstations, and 2 Cisco switches for a scientific project with 25 on-site researchers and several partner sites around the world.

positions.title: Junior System Administrator
positions.description: Administered Solaris, Linux, and Windows servers and workstations for the Statistics Department.
